trapomino

Class Animal

  • java.lang.Object
    • trapomino.Animal
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bear, Bird, Monkey, Penguin, Snake

    public abstract class Animal
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class will set the precedent for the methods pertaining to the Animals in the Game, all Animals will extend this class. This class will handle the defining and creation of an Animal by receiving and assigning the class variables pertaining to an Animal. This class will also return any of the variables when the corresponding method is called. This class will also check to see if an Animal can move or is trapped and will add, remove, and place blocks in the Grid.

      This method returns the Animal's X coordinate in the Grid

      This method returns the Animal's Y coordinate in the Grid

      This method sets the new X and Y coordinates and the new Positions of the Animal.
      abstract void move()
      This method will be expanded upon in each Animal child to move the Animal.
      boolean moveCheck(Position[] newPositions, int xMovement, int yMovement)
      This method sets the new X and Y coordinates of the position and then checks whether or not the Animal is able to move to the given new Position.
      void setName(Grid.SHAPE name)
      This method sets the Animal's Shape
      boolean trapCheck()
      This method checks whether or not the Animal has been trapped.

        public Grid grid

    • Constructor Detail

      • Animal

        public Animal(int x,
              int y,
              Grid grid,
              Position[] positions,
              Grid.SHAPE name,
              int score)
        This constructor sets the class variables defined above to the given variables. It then adds the Animal's blocks to the Grid.
        Parameters:
        x - - the X coordinate of the Animal
        y - - the Y coordinate of the Animal
        grid - - the Grid in which to place the Animal
        positions - - an Array of Positions the Animal occupies in the Grid.
        name - - the name of the Animal's Shape
        score - - the current score in the Game

      • move

        public abstract void move()
        This method will be expanded upon in each Animal child to move the Animal.

      • moveCheck

        public boolean moveCheck(Position[] newPositions,
                         int xMovement,
                         int yMovement)
        This method sets the new X and Y coordinates of the position and then checks whether or not the Animal is able to move to the given new Position.
        Parameters:
        newPositions - - the Array of Positions to check if empty
        xMovement - - the change in X coordinate in the Grid
        yMovement - - the change in Y coordinate in the Grid
        Returns:
        true if Animal can move or false if the Animal cannot move

      • trapCheck

        public boolean trapCheck()
        This method checks whether or not the Animal has been trapped.
        Returns:
        true if the Animal is trapped, or false if it has not been trapped

      • makeBlocks

        public void makeBlocks(int x,
                       int y,
                       Position[] newPositions)
        This method sets the new X and Y coordinates and the new Positions of the Animal. The method then adds the blocks to the grid at those Positions.
        Parameters:
        x - - the updated X coordinate of the Animal
        y - - the updated Y coordinate of the Animal
        newPositions - - the new set of Positions the Animal occupies on the Grid
